title: Getting started as a DJ: Mixing, mashups and digital turntables - Cole Plante

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the main goals of a DJ when mixing tracks?

options.label: A
options.text: To trigger samples, tracks, or clips and create a long journey.

options.label: B
options.text: To create a unique sound that no one has heard before.

options.label: C
options.text: To make the crowd dance as much as possible.

options.label: D
options.text: To show off their skills as a DJ.

multiple-choice.question: What is a mashup in the context of DJing?

options.label: A
options.text: A combination of two or more tracks played at the same time.

options.label: B
options.text: A type of music that is played in a club.

options.label: C
options.text: A way to mix tracks by using a specific technique.

options.label: D
options.text: A combination of two or more tracks that are combined into one new song.

multiple-choice.question: What is a mixer used for in DJing?

options.label: A
options.text: To play music from a CD.

options.label: B
options.text: To mix tracks and add effects such as beat roll and filter effects.

options.label: C
options.text: To record music.

options.label: D
options.text: To create a new song from scratch.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the main benefits of DJing technology?

options.label: A
options.text: It is only available to professional DJs.

options.label: B
options.text: It is only available to those who can afford expensive equipment.

options.label: C
options.text: Almost anyone can pursue a career in DJing with the right equipment.

options.label: D
options.text: It is only available to those who have a lot of experience.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the ways to get started with DJing?

options.label: A
options.text: By watching YouTube videos and tutorials.

options.label: B
options.text: By asking a friend who knows how to DJ.

options.label: C
options.text: By taking a class at a music school.

options.label: D
options.text: By buying expensive equipment.

title: Caesium or Cesium - Periodic Table of Videos

multiple-choice.question: What is the surprising use of caesium?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: It is used to measure temperature.

options.label: C
options.text: It is used to measure pressure.

options.label: D
options.text: It is used to measure volume.

options.label: A
options.text: Because the length of the day would change.

options.label: B
options.text: Because the Earth's rotation would slow down.

options.label: C
options.text: Because the Earth's rotation would speed up.

options.label: D
options.text: Because the Earth's rotation would remain constant.

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: Why does caesium react violently with water?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it is a small atom that can be easily removed from the water.

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: D

title: What we can learn from galaxies far, far away - Henry Lin

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the main reasons why galaxy clusters are useful for scientific research?

options.label: A
options.text: They are very small and can be easily studied.

options.label: B
options.text: They are very hot and can be used to study the physics of high temperatures.

options.label: C
options.text: They are massive and isolated systems that can be used to study the universe at large scales.

options.label: D
options.text: They are very cold and can be used to study the physics of low temperatures.

multiple-choice.question: What is dark matter, and how does it affect our understanding of the universe?

options.label: A
options.text: Dark matter is a type of normal matter that is difficult to detect, but it does not affect our understanding of the universe.

options.label: B
options.text: Dark matter is a type of normal matter that is difficult to detect, and it affects our understanding of the universe by making it more massive than we thought.

options.label: C
options.text: Dark matter is a type of matter that does not like to interact very much, except through gravity, and it makes up most of the universe's matter.

options.label: D
options.text: Dark matter is a type of matter that is made up of atoms, and it makes up most of the universe's matter.

multiple-choice.question: What is dark energy, and how does it affect the universe?

options.label: A
options.text: Dark energy is a type of normal matter that is difficult to detect, and it affects the universe by making it expand at a slower rate.

options.label: B
options.text: Dark energy is a type of normal matter that is difficult to detect, and it affects the universe by making it expand at a faster rate.

options.label: C
options.text: Dark energy is a type of matter that causes the universe to expand at an ever-increasing rate, and it is responsible for the accelerated expansion of the universe.

options.label: D
options.text: Dark energy is a type of matter that causes the universe to contract at a faster rate, and it is responsible for the collapse of the universe.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main idea behind the concept of galaxy clusters as "scaled-down versions" of the universe?

options.label: A
options.text: Galaxy clusters are miniature versions of the universe, with all the same properties and features.

options.label: B
options.text: Galaxy clusters are representative slices of the universe, scaled down to a smaller size.

options.label: C
options.text: Galaxy clusters are isolated systems that are not connected to the rest of the universe.

options.label: D
options.text: Galaxy clusters are not useful for scientific research because they are too small.

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of studying galaxy clusters in understanding the universe at large scales?

options.label: A
options.text: Studying galaxy clusters can help us understand the physics of high temperatures and the behavior of hot gas.

options.label: B
options.text: Studying galaxy clusters can help us understand the physics of the very small and the behavior of dark matter.

options.label: C
options.text: Studying galaxy clusters can help us understand the universe at large scales and the behavior of dark energy.

options.label: D
options.text: Studying galaxy clusters is not useful for understanding the universe at large scales.

title: Why do we cry? The three types of tears - Alex Gendler

multiple-choice.question: What is special about Iris's lacrimal glands?

options.label: A
options.text: They produce only basal tears.

options.label: B
options.text: They produce only reflex tears.

options.label: C
options.text: They produce tears at a rate of ten ounces per day.

options.label: D
options.text: They produce tears to help Iris see better in low light.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of the lipid layer in Iris's tears?

options.label: A
options.text: To keep Iris hydrated.

options.label: B
options.text: To protect Iris's skin from damage.

options.label: C
options.text: To prevent the other layers from evaporating.

options.label: D
options.text: To help Iris see through her tears.

multiple-choice.question: What happens when Onion takes off her jacket and Iris is exposed to the chemical reaction?

options.label: A
options.text: Iris starts to laugh uncontrollably.

options.label: B
options.text: Iris starts to weep uncontrollably due to reflex tears.

options.label: C
options.text: Iris becomes angry and starts to shout.

options.label: D
options.text: Iris becomes sad and starts to cry emotional tears.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of emotional tears?

options.label: A
options.text: To help Iris see better in low light.

options.label: B
options.text: To stabilize Iris's mood as quickly as possible.

options.label: C
options.text: To elicit sympathy or show submission.

options.label: D
options.text: To help Iris communicate with others.

multiple-choice.question: What are some of the benefits of emotional tears?

options.label: A
options.text: They contain higher levels of stress hormones and can calm Iris down.

options.label: B
options.text: They help Iris see better in low light.

options.label: C
options.text: They make Iris feel sad and angry.

options.label: D
options.text: They help Iris communicate with others.
